title: Buzz from NFL training camps: What we learned about the Packers, Ravens, Titans and 13 more teams

title: Sources: Banged-up Browns sign 5th QB in Huntley
content: The Browns are signing quarterback Tyler Huntley, sources said, adding depth with multiple passers nursing injuries.

title: Chargers' Perryman out of jail, won't face charges
content: Chargers linebacker Denzel Perryman was released from police custody Monday afternoon and will not face criminal charges after he was arrested Friday night.

title: Sources: Raiders trade CB Bennett to Eagles
content: The Raiders are trading cornerback Jakorian Bennett to the Eagles in exchange for defensive tackle Thomas Booker IV, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Boone: Judge returning to Yanks' lineup Tuesday
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge will return to action Tuesday against the Rangers, manager Aaron Boone said after his team lost its fourth straight game Monday.

title: New Cubs starter Soroka (shoulder) headed to IL
content: New Chicago Cubs starter Mike Soroka left his first game with his new team with right shoulder discomfort and will require a stint on the injured list.

title: Sources: LeBron congratulated Luka on new deal
content: LeBron James congratulated Luka Doncic on his new three-year, $165 million contract extension via a video call Saturday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: Son to join LAFC in MLS record move
content: South Korea international Son Heung-Min is poised to sign with MLS side LAFC, with an unveiling happening as soon as Wednesday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Fan accused of sex toy toss faces multiple charges
content: The man arrested for allegedly throwing a sex toy onto the court during last week's Valkyries-Dream game faces charges of disorderly conduct, public indecency/indecent exposure and criminal trespass, according to law enforcement records.

content: Parents alleged, a person in blue clothes sexually assaulted their daughter in the school premises on July 30 between 11.15 am and 3 pm, the officials said.

title: Gas leak blast in Hyderabad‚Äôs Medchal market kills one, injures two
content: Preliminary investigation revealed that a leak in the gas pipe had allowed gas to accumulate in the poorly ventilated space, leading to a blast when the stove was ignited.

title: Karnataka receives proposals worth ‚Çπ17,000 crore for Vijayapura District
content: Some 30 companies from the FMCG sector, 25 from the solar sector, and 15 from the textile sector have shown interest in investing in Vijayapura

content: Prakash Chandra Joshi, 61, was among the three Indian nationals abducted in the Kayes region of Mali during an armed assault by suspected terrorists on July 1; the family says they have no information about his whereabouts

content: In a statement, he terms as ‚Äúindecent‚Äù the attempts by some to paint his visit to the Chief Minister‚Äôs residence in a political light

content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin reaffirms his government‚Äôs commitment to industrial development in the southern districts. He announces 4 major projects for Thoothukudi and Tirunelveli districts

title: India‚Äôs marine fish landings drop 2% in 2024: CMFRI
content: Gujarat retained its top position in overall fish landings with 7.54 lakh tonnes, followed by Tamil Nadu (6.79 lakh tonnes)

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 12 Live Updates: PM Modi Likely To Be Felicitated By NDA MPs For Op Sindoor Success
content: The Opposition is likely to continue protests in both the Houses of Parliament even as the government has decided to push its legislative agenda and aim to get five listed Bills passed in both the Houses today.

title: Anil Ambani Summoned In Rs 17,000 Crore Loan Fraud Case Today
content: Reliance Group chairman Anil Ambani will today appear before probe agency Enforcement Directorate for questioning in connection with an alleged Rs 17,000 crore worth bank loan fraud-linked money laundering case.

title: 'We Are Supported By BRICS Partners': Russia On Trump's Tariff Threats
content: Russia has accused the Donald Trump administration in the US of pursuing a "neocolonial" policy against nations in Global South to maintain Washington's hegemony, and said no amount of tariffs and sanctions could change the natural course of history.

title: Rape Convict Ram Rahim Gets Another Parole, This Time For 40 Days
content: Rape convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim has been granted a 40-day parole, three months after he was given a 21-day furlough.

title: "Nothing Will Happen": Omar Abdullah Amid J&K Statehood Restoration Buzz
content: Omar Abdullah's remarks came on the eve of the sixth anniversary of the abrogation of Article 370, amidst a growing chorus for the restoration of statehood to Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Andhra Deploys 'Kumki' Elephants To Combat Rising Human-Elephant Conflict
content: The Government of Andhra Pradesh has deployed specially trained "Kumki" elephants to the regions most affected by the long-standing issue of human-elephant conflict.

title: 55 Years Later, An Emotional Homecoming For Maharashtra Minister At 'Meghdoot'
content: In a heartwarming moment, Maharashtra's Tourism Minister and Shiv Sena leader Shambhuraj Desai was seen in tears as he stepped into the government bungalow 'Meghdoot,' the very home where he was born and raised over five decades ago.

title: "Hell Hath No Fury Like Woman's Wrath": Rani Kapur's Lawyer To NDTV
content: Lawyer Vaibhav Gaggar also spoke about the cease-and-desist letter sent by automotive parts manufacturer Sona Comstar - part of the Rs 30,000 crore Sona Group - to Sunjay Kapur's mother Rani Kapur.

title: "Result Of NATO Policies": Russia Exits Nuclear Treaty With US After Trump's Submarine Move
content: Amid US President Donald Trump's increasing pressure to end the war in Ukraine, Russia has announced that it no longer considered itself bound by the 1987 Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with America.

title: Bihar Man Declares 90-Year-Old Father Dead, Sells Ancestral Land For Rs 2 Lakh
content: Raj Narayan Thakur, 90, from Bihar's Muzaffarpur has alleged that his fifth son, Dilip Thakur, declared him dead on paper and sold the ancestral property for Rs 2 lakh.

title: Scientists Solve Mystery Of What Killed Over 5 Billion Starfish After A Decade
content: Scientists say they have at last solved the mystery of what killed more than 5 billion sea stars off the Pacific coast of North America in a decade-long epidemic.

title: What Happened At Mamata Banerjee's 12-Minute Meet With Her MPs And Why
content: A churning in Bengal's ruling Trinamool Congress is in progress ahead of next year's assembly election in the state.

title: US Government Restricts Sports Visas For Transgender Women
content: The U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced on Monday it has updated its immigration policy to restrict visa eligibility for transgender women seeking to compete in women's sports.

title: Dummy Bomb Goes Undetected In Red Fort Security Drill, 7 Cops Reprimanded
content: Seven Delhi Police personnel, including constables and head constables, have been reprimanded as a dummy bomb goes undetected in the Red Fort during a security drill, Delhi police said.

title: Trump Administration To Open Grand Jury Probe Into Obama Officials: Report
content: U.S. Attorney General has directed federal prosecutors to launch a grand jury probe into allegations that members of Democratic former President Barack Obama's administration manufactured intelligence on Russia's interference in the 2016 elections

title: 5 Bangladeshi Immigrants Arrested For Forcibly Trying To Enter Red Fort: Cops
content: Delhi Police said on Monday they have arrested five Bangladeshi "illegal immigrants" and launched an investigation.

title: Shiv Sena Leader Alleges "Housing Jihad" In Mumbai Slum Redevelopment
content: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Nirupam on Monday claimed some builders have conspired to allot houses belonging to Hindus to Muslims in two slum redevelopment projects in Jogeshwari area of Mumbai as part of "housing jihad".

title: Working With Influencers To Promote Tourism Destinations: Union Minister
content: The Tourism Ministry engages with social media influencers, both through collaboration requests received and through public engagement initiatives to promote tourism destinations, products, experiences and events, Lok Sabha was informed on Monday.

title: Amit Shah Meets Top West Bengal BJP Leaders To Discuss 2026 Poll Strategy
content: Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday took stock of the political situation in West Bengal in a meeting with key BJP leaders of the state, including its president Samik Bhattacharya and national general secretary in-charge Sunil Bansal.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Denied Release On Bond To Await Sentencing
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs can't go home from jail to await sentencing on his prostitution-related conviction, a judge said Monday, denying the rap and style mogul's latest bid for bail.

content: The forum said the police provided ‚Äúhasty and incorrect information‚Äù that¬†triggered ‚Äúhate speech and hateful actions¬†against Kashmiris‚Äù

content: Special Intensive Revision of voter list and seats reserved for Scheduled Castes and Tribes come in for special mention

title: Army Chief Hails Operation Sindoor as landmark in India‚Äôs counter-terrorism doctrine
content: At an event in IIT Madras, he says 88-hour operation was unprecedented in scale, range, depth, and strategic impact, and was executed across the DIME spectrum

title: SC questions U.P.‚Äôs use of ordinance to take control of Banke Bihari temple
content: Justice Surya Kant expressed disapproval of the clandestine manner employed to secure the court‚Äôs permission in getting a judgment on May 15 by filing a civil dispute to use temple funds to develop the Shri Banke Bihari Temple Corridor project

title: Defence panel reviews women‚Äôs role; Rajnath vows greater representation
content: Defence officials highlight expanding opportunities for women across all three armed services as Centre gives commitment to facilitate greater inclusion

title: RTC strike to go ahead from August 5 despite High Court direction: JAC
content: A final round of talks was held on Monday between Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy, and representatives of the employees‚Äô union, but the discussions ended without a resolution.¬†

title: BJP leader Amit Malviya‚Äôs ‚Äòno language called Bengali‚Äô jibe sparks outrage, leaves Trinamool fuming
content: The Trinamool Congress accused the BJP of ‚Äòsystematically promoting xenophobia and othering, with Bengalis being deliberately targeted across States‚Äô

title: Operation Sindoor and Chenab Bridge to feature on Independence Day invites
content: Independence Day invites from the Ministry of Defence for this year‚Äôs Independence Day celebrations will have Operation Sindoor as the central theme

title: Bihar leaders find SIR draft rolls ‚Äòdifficult‚Äô to compare
content: While the Election Commission has said that no political party in the State has filed an objection, the Opposition parties allege that the poll body has ‚Äúdeliberately‚Äù made comparison of current and earlier rolls complicated

title: Trade unions, farm outfits demand parliamentary approval of trade treaties
content: CTUs and SKM urge the Centre to reject U.S. tariffs, uphold sovereignty of India; in joint statement, they say ‚ÄòEast India Company colonised India through trade and today, CETA and U.S. trade deals are the new instruments of corporate imperialism‚Äô

title: Pollution Control Boards have power to impose restitutionary damages under Water, Air Acts, says Supreme Court
content: The aim is to completely restore polluted air and waterbodies back to their original, pristine selves in an ecosystem, says Bench

title: Modi likely to take ride on Yellow Line metro, launch Vande Bharat to Belagavi
content: The Karnataka unit of the Bharatiya Janata Party is leaving no stone unturned to turn the twin inaugurations into a high-profile occasion.

title: Kerala HC dismisses habeas corpus petition after woman appears before court
content: The petitioner claimed that he had married the woman, who was traced by the police at Maradu in Kochi, in 2022 after meeting her through a matrimonial website

title: Nitish Kumar announces domicile policy, new welfare schemes in Bihar
content: The new policy will apply from the Teachers Recruitment Examination-4 in 2025 onward; only Bihar residents will now be eligible for government teaching positions under this policy

title: Skeletal remains found at new location near site no. 11 in Dharmasthala
content: Complainant suggests that a site at a new location nearby site no. 11 also be dug; new site not among the 13 identified by him before

title: PM Modi to address NDA Parliamentary Party meeting on August 5
content: The Prime Minister is also likely to be felicitated by the parliamentary party over his government's military response to the terror strike

title: Producer Sandra Thomas to take legal recourse after rejection of nominations for KFPA office-bearer election
content: She alleges that returning officer acted at the behest of a few persons who have been controlling the apex body of producers for long

title: Bombay High Court says ‚ÄòNo‚Äô to contempt proceedings against CPI(M)
content: The party has publicly criticised the court‚Äôs recent observations while rejecting its plea to hold a protest in support of Gaza

title: Karnataka Health Department brings AYUSH medicines, testing labs under FSDA purview
content: ‚ÄòMove is to control the quality of medicines being prescribed under the alternative systems of medicine, especially as their consumption continues to rise among the public‚Äô

title: Commission report on Kaleshwaram will be tabled in the Assembly to decide future course of action: CM¬†
content: Revanth Reddy says former chief minister K. Chandrashekhar Rao can share his views on the report in the Assembly¬†¬†

title: Tariff war: Why Trump's threat is unlikely to wean India off Russian crude - Explained
content: India is likely to continue sourcing crude oil from Russia if it remains cheaper, despite potential pressure from the US government. The decision is based on prioritizing consumer interests and market realities, with India emphasizing the transparency of its oil trade with Russia. Recent decline in India's crude petroleum imports from Russia is due to market dynamics.

title: Unpaid salaries, wage revision: Why Karnataka transport workers are protesting
content: A strike by Karnataka's state-run transport workers has disrupted bus services across the state, causing significant inconvenience to commuters. The workers are protesting over unpaid salaries, wage revision delays, and privatization concerns. Despite a high court directive to halt the strike, unions proceeded, demanding the release of 38 months of arrears.

title: Gill‚Äôs baptism by Bazball: Calm head, bat full of runs and a gun team
content: Shubman Gill's first Test captaincy assignment, during the England tour, presented a mix of challenges and triumphs. Despite losing key players like Rishabh Pant and Jasprit Bumrah to injuries and workload concerns, Gill led India to a series-levelling victory. His impressive batting performance, scoring 754 runs, coupled with his focus on team dynamics, eased the transition from the Rohit Sharma era.

title: How Ukrainian soldier dodged death and mines on e-bike flown in by drone - video
content: In a daring rescue, a wounded Ukrainian soldier, call sign "Tanker," was saved after being stranded in enemy territory near Siversk. Following a Russian ambush, his brigade devised a plan to deliver an e-bike by drone. Despite initial failures and a landmine incident, Tanker managed to reach his unit. Amidst this, Kyiv faced renewed missile strikes, prompting President Zelensky to urge allies for action against Russia.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet shares career advice she got from her father at 15: ‚ÄòYou're never‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet attributes her success to a childhood lesson from her father: strive for excellence to be undeniable. This principle fueled her journey from a speech contest loss to leading a global consulting firm. Sweet emphasizes adaptability, echoing Jamie Dimon and Satya Nadella, as crucial for sustained growth and relevance in today's dynamic business landscape.

title: India upcoming matches 2025: Full cricket schedule after England series
content: Following a drawn Test series against England, India faces a busy cricket schedule in 2025. The Asia Cup in September will see a young team led by Suryakumar Yadav, while Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli return for the ODIs in Australia. The year concludes with a full home series against South Africa, featuring Tests, ODIs, and T20Is.

title: Security lapse at Red Fort: Dummy bomb goes undetected in security drill; 7 personnel suspended
content: In a significant security lapse, seven police personnel have been suspended after failing to detect a dummy bomb during a routine drill at Delhi's Red Fort. The security test aimed to assess the alertness of officers at the access control point. A team successfully breached security with a fake explosive, raising serious concerns about preparedness.

title: Karnataka bus strike begins: Employees defy HC order as talks fail; thousands stranded
content: Karnataka's public transport system is paralyzed as state road transport corporation employees initiate an indefinite strike, demanding wage revision and clearance of salary arrears. Despite a High Court stay, bus services are suspended across major cities, leaving commuters stranded and scrambling for alternatives.

title: Google reportedly stops funding of 214 groups, over 50 of them are related to ...
content: Google has reportedly removed over 50 diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) organizations from its public funding list, according to The Tech Transparency Project. This shift comes as Google prioritizes AI investments and navigates an evolving legal landscape. The company states the changes reflect 2024 contributions and aim for maximum impact on pro-innovation policies, amidst a broader retreat from DEI commitments.

title: Latest WTC Points Table: India climb to third , England slide
content: India, who were fourth before the Oval Test, have moved up to third in the WTC standings, swapping places with England, who dropped to fourth after suffering their second defeat of the cycle. Although both teams have identical records, two wins, two losses, and one draw, England lost two crucial points due to a slow over rate in the Lord‚Äôs Test, giving India the edge.

title: Stock market today: Nifty opens below 24,700; Sensex down over 150 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was below 24,700, BSE Sensex dropped over 150 points.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook confirms: Majority of new iPhones sold in the US are 'made' in India
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook stated that most iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were made in India, despite Donald Trump's criticism of this manufacturing shift. India has become the main hub for iPhone production for the US market, while China focuses on non-US regions. Apple is experiencing record revenue growth in India, driven by strong iPhone sales.

title: 'Decision made': Israel to take full control of the Gaza Strip?
content: Amid stalled ceasefire talks, Israel is reportedly considering a plan to fully occupy the Gaza Strip, potentially escalating its conflict with Hamas. According to Israeli media, Prime Minister Netanyahu has privately discussed this move, despite opposition from within the military establishment. This shift follows a breakdown in hostage negotiations and growing frustration over Hamas's control.

title: IND vs ENG | 'I only believe in S...' ‚Äì Google salutes Siraj's heroics at Oval
content: Mohammed Siraj's sensational five-wicket haul propelled India to a thrilling six-run victory over England at The Oval, leveling the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy 2-2. Siraj's match-winning performance dismantled England's batting lineup on the final day, overcoming earlier setbacks like a dropped catch. Google India celebrated Siraj's heroics with a clever tribute referencing his viral quote about Jasprit Bumrah.

title: 'Toughest days of my life': Hemant Soren pens emotional note after father's death
content: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren penned a heartfelt tribute to his father, Shibu Soren, following the JMM founder's death at 81. Describing it as his life's toughest time, Soren acknowledged the immense loss for both himself and the state. He vowed to continue his father's struggle for tribal empowerment, honoring his legacy of unwavering dedication and sacrifice.

title: Salaries of Bengaluru players, including Chhetri, suspended; club issues statement
content: Bengaluru FC have suspended salaries for its first-team players and staff, including Sunil Chhetri, due to uncertainty surrounding the Indian Super League's future. This decision follows unresolved issues between FSDL and AIFF, impacting the league's continuation. The club emphasises its commitment to youth development while urging a swift resolution to the impasse for the sake of Indian football.

title: Venus Williams addresses plastic surgery stance: Emphasizes comfort with her natural look
content: Venus Williams, the tennis star, recently shared her perspective on cosmetic surgery, emphasizing personal empowerment over societal expectations. While content with her current appearance, she stated she would consider procedures if it enhanced her self-esteem. After overcoming health challenges, including fibroid surgery, she made a comeback to professional tennis with the support of her fianc√©, Andrea Preti.

title: Ram Rahim free again: Dera chief given 40-day parole; to return to prison mid-September
content: Gurmeet Ram Rahim, the head of Dera Sacha Sauda, has been released on a 40-day parole. This is his second release this year. Earlier, he was granted furlough in April. Ram Rahim is serving time for rape and murder convictions since 2017. His release has sparked discussions, considering his past conviction.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Do you think the jawans complain about the cold?' - Gavaskar
content: Sunil Gavaskar slammed the growing trend of workload management, urging players to show the same commitment as soldiers guarding the borders. Praising Siraj‚Äôs relentless effort across five Tests and Pant‚Äôs bravery, Gavaskar emphasized national pride, saying representing India is a rare honour that shouldn't be compromised due to minor injuries.

title: Brooke Hogan‚Äôs husband slams Hulk Hogan: No effort to meet grandkids ‚Äî ‚ÄúThere was no interest‚Äù
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: 'Scared to resume work': Indian cab driver attacked in Dublin; hit twice on head
content: An Indian cab driver in Dublin was assaulted and injured after being struck with a bottle by passengers who also shouted xenophobic remarks. The incident, which occurred in Poppintree, Ballymun, left the driver, Lakhvir Singh, traumatized and hesitant to return to work.

title: Impending disaster: Bageshwar mines risk collapse, govt report warns of Jyotirmath-style sinking
content: A government panel warns that unregulated mining in Bageshwar is creating a Jyotirmath-like crisis. Unsafe excavation practices are causing landslides and spring depletion. Residents report cracks in houses and declining crop yields. The National Green Tribunal has directed a seismic study. The High Court has stayed mining activity and ordered inspections.

title: Watch: Gambhir and India coaches go wild after win at The Oval
content: Gautam Gambhir's passionate celebrations highlighted India's dramatic six-run victory over England at The Oval, securing a 2-2 series draw. The win, fueled by Mohammed Siraj's five-wicket haul, marked a turning point for Gambhir's coaching tenure after facing initial challenges. Under Shubman Gill's captaincy, the team displayed resilience and fighting spirit throughout the intense Test series.

title: IND vs ENG |‚ÄòIt had to be Siraj‚Äô ‚Äì Ex-England skipper on India‚Äôs fightback
content: Nasser Hussain lauded India's well-deserved 2-2 series draw against England, emphasising Mohammed Siraj's pivotal role in securing the final wicket. He highlighted the captivating nature of the series, with each Test extending to the final day, and stressed the responsibility of cricket's 'Big Three' to protect Test cricket's future amid concerns about its viability in other nations.

title: IND vs ENG Test | Ben Stokes on verbal duels: 'Pretty sure no one's crying''
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy witnessed heated exchanges between India and England players. Despite the tension, Ben Stokes downplayed the incidents. India secured a thrilling six-run victory in the fifth Test. This resulted in a 2-2 draw in the series. Mohammed Siraj's outstanding bowling performance led India to victory. He took five wickets in the final innings.

title: India fans make unusual demands after Telangana Police congratulates DSP Siraj
content: Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance in the fifth Test against England led to widespread admiration. The Telangana Police congratulated the Hyderabad-born pacer. Fans humorously demanded Siraj's promotion within the police force. Siraj is currently a Deputy Superintendent of Police under the sports quota. He ended the series as the highest wicket-taker. His performance helped India level the series.

title: 114-year-old Shigeko Kagawa becomes Japan's oldest living person; shares one SIMPLE longevity tip, 'I don‚Äôt have....'
content: The love of her family members serves as the foundation for Ms. Kagawa's happiness. She receives continuous joy through the combination of home support and her friendships with both former patients, and her existing social network. Local officials have honored her outstanding life achievements through official recognition for her dedicated service to the community

title: Gabrielle Union on menopause: 'It makes it hard' ‚Äî motherhood now more emotional, exhausting
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: IND vs ENG: Gavaskar flaunts his 'lucky jacket' after India level series 2-2 - Watch
content: Sunil Gavaskar's 'lucky jacket,' worn during India's Gabba Test victory in 2021, resurfaced during the thrilling India vs England series finale. Gavaskar proudly displayed the jacket after India's dramatic six-run victory at The Oval, which levelled the series 2-2. He had hinted at wearing it, believing it would bring luck, and indeed, India secured a memorable win.

title: Top stocks to sell today: Recommendations for August 5- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests selling Naukri and Tata Motors. Naukri, trading below its 200 DMA, is expected to decline to Rs 1320, while Tata Motors, having broken a consolidation pattern, is projected to fall to Rs 585.

title: Viral video: Wild! KL Rahul's father-in-law Suniel Shetty goes crazy after India win
content: India defeated England in a thrilling Test match at The Oval, with the series ending in a 2-2 draw. Mohammed Siraj took five wickets. Suniel Shetty's enthusiastic celebration went viral. Ahan Shetty and Athiya Shetty shared their excitement online. Other Bollywood stars like Kareena Kapoor Khan and Anil Kapoor also celebrated the victory. The win sparked national pride and celebration.

title: ‚ÄòSaved from gallows only due to age‚Äô: 5 cops jailed till death for fake encounter
content: In a landmark verdict, a CBI court in Mohali sentenced five former Punjab Police officials to life imprisonment for the 1993 abduction, torture, and murder of seven innocent individuals, including three SPOs. The court cited the convicts' advanced age as the only reason for not imposing the death penalty, emphasizing their inhumane conduct. Each convict was also fined Rs 3.

title: ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô Box Office: Film past Rs 302 cr mark in India; lowest single-day earning on third Monday
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda made over Rs 300 crore. The film slowed down in its third week. 'Saiyaara' earned Rs 172.75 crore in its first week and Rs 107.75 crore in the second. New releases like 'Mahavtar Narsimha', 'Son Of Sardaar 2', and 'Dhadak 2' are now in cinemas.

title: Japan‚Äôs oldest living person Shigeko Kagawa turns 114; shares longevity tips
content: Shigeko Kagawa, a 114-year-old retired physician, has been recognized as Japan's oldest living person, following the passing of Miyoko Hiroyasu. Kagawa attributes her longevity to a life of freedom, independence, and playfulness, embodying Japan's 'ikigai' philosophy. Japan's high life expectancy is attributed to factors like diet, active lifestyles, strong social connections, and accessible healthcare.

title: Josh Allen delights at Bills camp: Reunites with Oishei Children‚Äôs Hospital; touching fan moment
content: At Buffalo Bills training camp, Josh Allen impressed with his on-field performance, connecting with receivers despite injuries. The highlight, however, was a heartwarming reunion with Annabella and Blake, two Champion kids from Oishei Children‚Äôs Hospital. Allen, who supports the hospital through the Patricia Allen Fund, shared selfies and signed autographs, creating a memorable moment beyond the game.

title: Unemployment: Less than 15% placed under PMKVY; what govt data shows
content: Government data reveals that over 1.6 crore Indian youth have been trained under PMKVY since 2015, but job placements remain low, with only 24.3 lakh securing employment. The government is now focusing on aligning skilling with industry needs through district-level studies and financial schemes to promote self-employment, while also evaluating PMKVY 4.0 for improvements.

title: Ben Shelton shares sweet family moment: Dad watches Rodman‚Äôs return; Washington Spirit shines
content: Trinity Rodman's return to Washington Spirit excites many. Ben Shelton's father, Bryan, eagerly anticipates her first game after injury. He checks TV channels to watch her play. Rodman supports Shelton at Wimbledon amid recovery. She addresses commentators' errors about her identity. Her support and comeback create a heartwarming moment. This shows a strong bond between the families.

title: Cardiologist explains the right way to measure blood pressure at home
content: Accurate blood pressure readings are crucial for health management. Incorrect techniques can lead to skewed results, potentially misdiagnosing hypertension or prompting unnecessary medication adjustments. Following proper guidelines, such as correct posture, arm support, cuff size, and multiple readings, ensures reliable measurements. Regular monitoring and device verification with a doctor are also recommended.

title: After 137 years, Kashmir‚Äôs oldest hotel loses battle for legacy
content: The J&K government has taken control of the Nedous Hotel in Gulmarg, ending a 137-year-old legacy. Established in 1888, the colonial-era landmark was once a hub for royalty, revolution, and political aristocracy. The Gulmarg Development Authority issued an eviction notice due to a lease that lapsed 40 years ago, despite the family's legal challenges.

title: Taylor Swift nears Chiefs ownership: Kelce jacket inspires NFL line; football meets fashion
content: Kristin Juszczyk, the designer, is launching a new NFL collection. This follows Taylor Swift's viral moment in a custom jacket. The collection celebrates fan culture and team loyalty. It features Chiefs-themed items like corsets and tees. Juszczyk acknowledges the support from Chiefs Kingdom. She credits Swift and Brittany Mahomes for boosting her career.

title: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.

title: Brewers playing it safe with Misiorowski
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . sportsmail's fantasy baseball fantasy writers have contributed to the news cycle . the sports , Chicago White Sox , Seattle Mariners and the Washington Nationals are the only clubs that are not in action .
